* Iron Raptor listened to Battera answer her questions the best she could, 
taking in all that she told and thinking over every bit of it very 
carefully.
It really DID all sound too good to be true, and it sounded so convincing as 
Battera had explained all.
And the thought of the Beast Wars being over did sound very nice, thinking 
that she wouldn�t have to worry about being scrapped and would be able to 
settle down and live a normal life. It really was a nice thought�but it 
still didn�t seem as if it was ever going to happen.
There had been alliance after alliance and every one ended with bots being 
injured and one side betray, peace seemed like something out of a fairy tail 
by now. Every bot hoped for it but it never came, the thought of reaching 
peace now seeming more impossible to think of then she would care to admit.
But even now as she pondered Batteras words she was reminded of a saying 
that she had heard in the past, one that seemed more ancient that first 
thought:
Even in the darkest of Night,
There will�and always be,
A twinkle of Light.
And in those few words, there stood the hope of the light of peace in the 
darkness of this war�however small it may be.
And there�stood her answer as well.
Iron Raptor glanced towards Prowl for a moment before turning her optics 
towards Battera, her answer written all over them as a smile creased her 
lips.*

� Alright�I�ll join you and your causes for peace. The Matrix knows I want 
it as much as any other bot fighting this cursid war.�

* But even as she spoke those words she knew that there was a 99.9% chance 
that peace wouldn�t be reached and the Beast Wars would go on�but she had to 
give it a chance.
However, just in case she would power up her Second Beast Mode just in case 
the Predacons decided to pull on of their little tricks.
Though, first she had to deal with a few more things before she was able to 
leave, things that wouldn�t take more then a mega-cycle or so at more to 
sort out.*

� Though, I do have to warn you. You�ve come at a rather busy time for 
me�and I�ll need a bit of time to get a few things straightened out before I 
leave for this Embassy of yours.�

* Iron Raptor then straightened her stand as she remembered something, about 
that intruder that they had caught earlier today and what Battera said about 
the Predacon commanders joining the Peace Talks as well.
She had brought up a scan on that intruder earlier and was rather surprised 
to find out that it was Hell Beast�s Second In Command, meaning: since he 
was gone, that they held one of the Predacon commander in their brig at this 
very moment.
Her icy blue optics then turned towards Kluster.*

� Speaking about Predacons, don�t we happen to be holding two on the brig at 
the moment?�

* Her optics then turning towards Prowl.*

� And doesn�t one of those bots just happen to be Hell Beasts Second In 
Command?�

* Iron Raptor then leaned against the table and crossed her arms, a 
thoughtful expression on her face.*

� And if I�m not mistaken, since Hell Beast is gone�wouldn�t that make that 
one�Predacon Commander of his lot?�

* She looked up at both men and awaited their answers, knowing that if they 
held a Predacon commander in their brig then they would have to be released 
to accompany them to this Peace Talk.*
